1139811127016079361.text: Autism develops in the womb, but it often only becomes visible once the brain enters a certain stage of development. And if you can't love aour autistic child and accept that this is the way they are and that there is nothing wrong with that, you are scum and don't deserve them.https://twitter.com/ShireenQudosi/status/1139023857912729601 …

1139811129104822272.text:
There is nothing wrong with being autistic.
Being neurodivergent is not bad.
if you can't accept the fact that that perfect little baby you imagined in your head doesn't exist, then you do not deserve to raise them.

1139942615309332481.text: It also runs in families too.

1139811130606587905.text:
I'm autistic. Whenever it is discussed, it is discussed as something alien to me, something I have and ought to fight.
It is not. It is a part of who I am, neither positively or negatively. I am autistic, a Theo that isn't autistic isn't me.

1139811131982319617.text: Get it through your thick, fucking neurotypical skulls: There is nothing wrong with me (thats connected to my autism), this is the way I am. Accept it, Live with it or fuck off.

1139811133555015681.text: It's not an illness, or a condition. The term is 'diagnosis', deliberately. Because that is a neutral term. Autism is a specific developmental pattern that affects the way the brain develops and structures itself. It. is. not. an. illness.

1139811135278817280.text: I've seen it l likened to neurological disorders like narcolepsy or clinical depression, which is both laughable and horrifically insulting. An autistic brain is not broken. It functions as intended. It just functions differently.

1139811136780558336.text:
And that's exactly what you normative jackasses do, isn't it? You look at something divergent, something different, and your neurotypical mind immediately goes "that's broken, we gotta fix it"

Fuck. You.

1139811138416214017.text:
I'm not broken, I'm not in need of fixing, I'm not a burden.

I am autistic.
And I'm proud of it.
